history.content:
During summer sessions, EECS does not manually over ride or allow time conflicts. This is because summer classes are compressed with lots of homework and no tutoring support.

On Monday, April 30th, I will purge the wait lists for summer CS classes of anyone who is identified as having a time conflict. The result will be wait lists that more accurately reflect students' chances of getting into a class.

TO RESOLVE A TIME CONFLICT:

1. In some cases, there may be open seats in other sections of a class that do not conflict with your already-enrolled class. In this case, you will need to drop the entire class and re-enroll into the sections with open seats. CAUTION: If you drop and there are no open seats in the lecture or selected sections, you will end up at the bottom of the wait list. BE SURE that there are open seats before you drop the class. (I cannot restore your place in the wait list if this happens to you.)

2. You may choose to drop the other class which will resolve the time conflict. Assuming there are open seats in the section(s) you have already selected, you will then be enrolled. If there are no open seats, you will remain on the wait list but will NOT be purged. The system will automatically move you into the class as space becomes available.
history.subject: SU18 CS classes - Time Conflicts being purged from wait lists
